feed.title: SAP Community - Cloud Integration
feed.subtitle: Cloud Integration Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP DM - Plant Mapping/Conversion: Integration of different S/4 systems into one DM instance
entry.content:
Hi community,

we're currently implementing SAP DM (Digital Manufacturing) in our company. Due to the fact, that we only have two instances for SAP DM (DEV + PRD), we want to use the plant mapping /conversion as described in SAP help in order to integrate our DEV + QAS S/4 system with the DM Dev instance (https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-digital-manufacturing/integration-guide/mapping-plants-plant-conversion?locale=en-US&q=Plant+mapping).

We activated the mapping and added the mapping values. In our case we want to map the plant 1000 to the SAP DM plant 1000D for the development system and to 1000Q in our QAS-system. That means we added the following entries:
DEVSYSTEM:1000 --> 1000D
QASSYSTEM:1000 --> 1000Q

Based on the documentation that should be all, but it's not working and we don't know why. We already checked the Idoc, which we used for testing (LOIWCS), and it contains the correct sender system partner number as maintained in the mapping. The plant is also correctly send via Idoc, the SAP DM plant 1000D is also set up correctly. 

May be someone here in the community has a hint for us, what the problem could be.

Thanks in advance

entry.title: Business Partner Replication from S/4HANA Public Cloud to EWM fails due to missing General Role
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We are currently facing an issue with Business Partner replication via DRF from S/4HANA Public Cloud to a decentral SAP EWM system.

Scenario

  • In S/4HANA Public Cloud, when we create a Business Partner (with Customer and/or Vendor roles), the General role (000000) is not visible/maintained in the frontend.

  • When replicating this BP via DRF , the message is successfully sent from S/4HANA Cloud.

  • However, in EWM inbound processing , the message fails with an Application Error.

Error Log in EWM

In transaction SRT_MONI, we see the following details:

 

Analysis

  • EWM requires the General BP role (000000) to be present in order to assign and process additional roles (Customer, Vendor, etc.).

  • In S/4HANA Public Cloud, this General role seems to be handled internally, but it is not explicitly replicated via DRF.

  • As a result, the EWM inbound proxy cannot process the payload and throws the application error.

Questions

  1. Is there an official fix or SAP Note that covers this gap (e.g., automatic inclusion of General role during DRF replication)?

  2. If not, do we need to build a custom solution (BAdI / extension in S/4HANA Public Cloud or EWM) to enrich the payload with BP role 000000 before EWM processes it? If yes, is this only possible on the EWM side?

  3. Can confirm whether this scenario is supported out-of-the-box, or if it is out of scope for standard S/4HANA Cloud ↔ EWM integration?

Additional Context

  • The issue is reproducible with any new BP replication.

  • In S/4HANA Cloud, the DRF message monitor shows successful processing, but the EWM side always fails with the error mentioned.

  • We already verified that the inbound service BusinessPartnerSUITEBulkReplicateRequest_In is active and the communication arrangement is correct.

Any insights, SAP Notes, or confirmation from SAP would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,

entry.title: Call SAP BTP integration suite api from postman failing
entry.content:
Call SAP BTP integration suite api from postman is failing. 

I use the oauth/token url and I am getting successful access_token. I use client_id and client secret here. 

https://XXXXXX.authentication.xxxx.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token

When I use the access_token and call below api - it sends back 200 with login page. 

https://xxxx.integrationsuite.cfapps.us10-002.hana.ondemand.com/api/v1/BuildAndDeployStatus(TaskId='LAKEHOUSE_CONNECT')  

Any solution as to what could be problem

entry.title: iFlow is using incorrect credentials. how to update the credentials and redeploy it
entry.content:
Hello,

Received such notification from SAP regarding Integration Flow - 

These repeated connection attempts are significantly impacting the SuccessFactors environment.

From the Cloud Integration side, it appears that the iFlow is using incorrect credentials.

To prevent further issues, we have undeployed the iFlow. Please update the credentials and redeploy it.

Can you please advise where/how to update the credentials, is there any step-by-step guide available?

entry.title: Bad Request with HTTP Reciever Adapter with OAuth2 Client Credential
entry.content:
On SAP cloud integration I have configured an HTTP receiver adapter with OAuth2 client credentials and the appropriate security material. However, calling the API endpoint fails with a bad request error. The same call works with Postman/Bruno, though.
The authorization header with bearer **** can be seen in the request header log, but I believe the token is not present.
Attached is the configuration of the HTTP receiver adapter and the secret material.
A similar configuration works on the PI, but here the ClientId and Client Secret are not used to retrieve the token, but rather the Base64-encrypted token.
Are others experiencing similar problems, or is there a possible solution for this?

entry.title: External System to CPI connection issue
entry.content:
Hi,

Anyone have tried integrating from hookdeck to CPI IFlow? What's the Authentication method you use to connect? We have tried using OAuth2(Client Credentials) however it seems like it's not fetching or generating the token from the credentials (service key created in BTP) and getting 401 however when we use Bearer Token and manually input it, it works and is sending to the iFlow successfully.

Has anyone encountered this or what other ways of authentication method can you suggest?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: ServiceKey grant permissions to only specific iflows ?
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

I have a general question regarding the SAP Integration Suite.

Currently, we generate a ServiceKey to allow HTTP access to our iFlows from outside. Is there a way to restrict HTTP access using the ServiceKey to only specific iFlows?

As we understand it, a single ServiceKey currently grants access to all endpoints, which can be a security concern. Are there any best practices or configuration options to limit access for a ServiceKey to specific iFlows only? Thank you very much in advance for your support!

entry.title: Can we connect two non sap systems using sap cpi
entry.content: Can we connect two non sap systems using sap cpi so if we can connect so why we have most of the scenarios to connect with sap systems not on two non sap systems? is there any scenarios that can be included sap cpi with out sap on both sender and reciever

entry.title: Principal propagation in sap CPI to ECC
entry.content:
HI Members,

Hope you are doing well.

i have scenario as external system is sending data to SAP CPI from there it should reach to ECC via Cloud connector and do the transaction with same user as external system sent. where external system is using basic authentication and message is reaching to sap CPI but when request is going to ECC it giving error as "no identity configured for the user" . same user existed in sap ecc but its failing even we used the principal propagation setup in ECC and cert mapping in ECC.

 Can you please help me with details to do the principal propagation in SAP CPI to ECC .

Thanks & Regards

Madhu

entry.title: how to start learning SAP - trainings, courses
entry.content:
Hi everybody, 

I’m new here and I have a question. I want to learn SAP and am new to this technology. Yes, I know it’s pretty tough with a lot to learn. But I want to do it because I want to change my profile. My background is data warehouse development, data modeling, and ETL development. Here I want to pivot instead of diving deeper into AWS or Azure cloud; I want to learn SAP, maybe SAP BTP and Cloud.

What do you think? Are these good topics for the future and with my background? Is there anyone here who can offer advice on which courses and trainings to start with for an introduction?

entry.title: SAP Integration Suite - SMB (Server message block) adapter - error STATUS_BAD_NETWORK_NAME
entry.content:
#SAP #IntegrationSuite #SMB #ServerMessageBlock #STATUS_BAD_NETWORK_NAME 

SAP has recently launched a new version of SMB adapter that allows to connect to a on-premise fileshare using cloud connector. Note 3546814 -> Configure the SMB Sender Adapter | SAP Help Portal

Using the SAP help documentation, I am trying to use SMB adapter to connect to a Network fileshare in our On-premise network, via cloud connector.

I have configured the TCP connection to the FileShare server in Cloud connector, and configured the SMB sender adapter in the iFlow, however, I am getting the error :  STATUS_BAD_NETWORK_NAME 

I can open the same fileshare in the browser and it displays all the folders under that:

The TCP connection in cloud connector :

The SMB adapter configuration in the iFlow

(Z_NETAPP is a credential to the fileshare that I have created in Security Material in integration suite)

I have tried several changes in the SMB adapter connection and processing sections, but I am still getting the same issue everytime.

Since this is a new adapter (version) by SAP, I could not find much content in the SAP community search.

If anyone has used this adapter in any integration scenario, please suggest a solution to fix this problem.

 

Regards,

Bharat Bajaj

 

@finny_babu 

@ShilpaVij 

@UdoPaltzer

entry.title: Message and Header exchange from Child to Parent flows
entry.content: On a request reply through a process direct adapter to a producer iFlow, I've have been trying to pass a header value from a producer iFlow (Child flow or Called flow) to consumer iFlow (Parent flow or Calling flow). We ere not able to see the header passing. We made sure the headers were maintained in both the iFlow's allowed headers of runtime configuration. None of the headers came to the consumer iFlow from producer. Astonishingly, even the message that is set on exception subprocess of the child flow is not getting passed to parent flow on failures. Is it fair to expect this behavior, or this is not even possible in SAP CPI.

entry.content:
I am getting not authorized on launching Integration suite for Hana trial account. 

The role is present for my user. 

 

What could be missing ?

entry.title: Success Factor ecp to S4H Public Cloud Integration
entry.content:
In S4H we have only one Controlling Area A000 and in Sucess Factor Payroll we have multiple Controlling areas

While Using PA20 in ECP the system is checking with S4H config which are related to Controlling Area, 

Ask is how to handle this cases , i mean while with S4H the the system should check One Controlling Area , Mapping needs to be done where we can do Mapping 

Ex    S4H - A000 and ECP  we have 1000,2000,3000 all these needs to be mapped to A000 while checking in the S4H

entry.title: How to Use Parameters and Imported Archives in SAP CPI Message Mapping
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm currently working on a message mapping in SAP CPI and I'm not sure how to use the Parameter tab in the mapping editor. I understand it's meant for passing external values into the mapping, but I’m unclear on how it behaves at runtime or how to bind it properly from the iFlow.

Also, I’d love to understand how Imported Archives work in this context. Can we use custom Java functions from these archives inside user-defined functions (UDFs)? If so, what are the best practices for organizing and referencing them?

Any examples or insights from your experience would be really helpful. Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Resource Injection Failed: Error while pushing files. Cause: Request not supported. CPI error.
entry.content: Hello, I'm new to Cloud Integration. I'm getting an error when pushing the changes from MIG to Cloud iFlow.  "Resource Injection Failed: Error while pushing files. Cause: Request not supported". Please help!

entry.title: IDOCs failing in SAP system : IDoc: XXX Status: Error passing data to port | Problem with SOAP class
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have numerous IDOC-based scenarios between SAP and SAP Integration Suite.

We have recently noticed that a few IDocs fail in the SAP system with the message:

Status Text: IDoc: <Idoc number> Status: Error passing data to port

T100 Text: Problem with SOAP class

 

In SRT_LOG, there are entries as follows: 

  • The SOAP IDoc application could not be started successfully.
  • The problem occurred in the method call: execute_processing
  • 1007:SRT: Unsupported xstream found: ("HTTP Code 404 : Not Found")

SRT_LOG (Original XML Error)

There are other successful IDocs being sent at the same time to the SAP IS interface. This seems to me like a temporary connectivity issue between SAP and SAP IS, but I need your expert advice on how it can be identified and fixed to avoid such issues.

Regards,

Prajeet

entry.title: SAP ERP (ECC 6.0 on RISE) Integration with DRC Peppol Exchange – Questions for Belgium Setup
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

This is my first time implementing the integration between SAP ERP and SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) for Peppol Exchange, following SAP’s official documentation:
https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-edition/sap-document-and-reporting-compliance-cloud-edition/integrating-peppol-exchange-with-sap-erp?locale=en-US

However, I find the documentation quite high-level — it doesn’t go deep enough into the technical aspects, and I’m a bit confused about certain configuration points.

Context

I’m currently implementing the integration between SAP ERP ECC 6.0 (SAP RISE) and SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) – Peppol Exchange for Belgium (BE).

So far, all the main configuration tasks have been completed:

  • The eDocument Cockpit is fully configured and working correctly in SAP ECC.

  • SAP DRC Peppol Exchange is deployed on SAP BTP (region: Frankfurt).

  • The ERP system is hosted on SAP RISE (region: Virginia).

  • The Cloud Connector is configured and connected to the corresponding BTP subaccount.

  • The Service Binding and Destination (DRC_PEPPOL) were successfully created in BTP.

  • A communication user with all necessary authorizations (SAP_BC_WEBSERVICE_SERVICE_USER, EDO_*, etc.) has been created.

  • The service endpoint in SOAMANAGER has been correctly configured and exposed according to SAP’s documentation at the following path:
    /sap/bc/srt/rfc/sap/dcppushservice/<xxx>/dcppushservice/pushrequest.

Despite all this, the connection between the ERP and the DRC Cloud Peppol service still cannot be established.
Ping tests return errors such as NIEHOST_UNKNOWN, NIECONN_REFUSED, or “Service Unreachable.”

At this point, I’m not sure whether the issue is related to:

  • Certificate or trust configuration between ERP and BTP,

  • A network limitation due to the cross-region setup (RISE Virginia ↔ BTP Frankfurt),

  • Or something missing in the Peppol participant configuration within the DRC instance.

Additionally, I’m unsure whether I should ask the client to explicitly allow outbound communication from the DRC Cloud service binding (created in BTP) through SAP’s internal firewall so that the ERP system can reach the endpoint.
If so, I would appreciate guidance on how this should be done — whether it should be managed directly in BTP Cockpit, via a SAP support ticket, or if it is enabled automatically once the binding is created.

Finally, the client assumes that XML ↔ UBL transformations must be handled via SAP Integration Suite (CPI), but based on my understanding, the standard SAP DRC solution should already manage these conversions internally.

1 Connection between RISE (Virginia) and BTP (Frankfurt)

Given that the ERP (RISE) and BTP environments are hosted in different regions, do I need to configure an additional SAP Cloud Connector or any special setup to enable secure communication between the two?
Or is the standard connection through the Service Binding and Destination configuration sufficient for DRC Cloud to reach the on-premise ERP?

2 eDocument Format and UBL/BIS 3.0 Transformation

According to SAP’s documentation, Peppol requires UBL BIS 3.0-compliant documents.
My main questions are:

  • Does the standard DRC solution automatically handle the XML → UBL BIS 3.0 transformation when sending eDocuments from SAP ERP to Peppol?

  • Conversely, when receiving documents from Peppol, does DRC automatically convert UBL BIS → XML so that it can be consumed by SAP ERP?

  • If these transformations are not handled natively, what’s the recommended approach to implement them?
    Specifically, how can I connect SAP DRC Cloud with SAP Integration Suite (iFlow) to intercept and transform the payload (UBL/XML) before it reaches the ERP?
    (I would really appreciate if anyone has implemented a similar setup or could share a best-practice example.)

I would also appreciate any insights on special settings that should be considered in the eDocument Cockpit for sending and/or receiving documents.

3. RISE and ECC Connectivity Considerations

The client refers to their system as SAP RISE, but technically the backend is SAP ECC 6.0.
Are there any official SAP guidelines or technical notes describing the recommended configuration for this hybrid scenario (RISE + DRC Cloud) — especially regarding trust setup, certificates, or communication channels?
The existing SAP documentation seems too generic, so any deeper or experience-based guidance would be very helpful.

Thank you in advance for your help and insights!
Any detailed documentation, SAP Notes, or examples from similar Belgium Peppol implementations would be highly appreciated.
